references.paper_title: An optimal algorithm for on-line bipartite matching
references.reason: This paper is foundational to online bipartite matching, providing a tight approximation guarantee that many subsequent works build upon.
This paper introduces the concept of class fairness in online matching, which directly motivates the current work, and also provides initial results and open problems that the current work solves.

references.paper_title: The price of fairness for indivisible goods
references.reason: This paper studies the price of fairness for indivisible goods, which is closely related to the current work, and provides a framework for quantifying the trade-off between fairness and efficiency.

This paper introduces the concept of the price of fairness and provides initial bounds on the trade-off between fairness and efficiency, which is relevant for the current work's analysis of the price of fairness in online class matching.
This paper provides a comprehensive overview of fair division mechanisms, which helps to contextualize the current work's fairness guarantees within the broader fair division literature.
